medium_description: North Carolina Annual Ambient Air Standard
long_description: Concentrations above this level are illegal in North Carolina.  This level refers to the average level over a period of {\bf one year}.
Concentrations above this level are illegal in North Carolina.  This level refers to the average level over a {\bf 24-hour} period.
Concentrations above this level are illegal in North Carolina.  This level refers to the average level over a {\bf one hour}> period.

brief_description: The {\bf Short Term} (1-hr) Texas Effects Screening Level
long_description: According to the Texas Natural Resource Conservation Commission, no health effects are thought to occur below this level. "Short-term" levels refer to the average exposure level during {\bf one hour}.

brief_description: The {\bf Long-Term} Texas Effects Screening Level
long_description: According to the Texas Natural Resource Conservation Commission,   no health effects are thought to occur below this level. "Long-term" levels refer to the average exposure level during a {\bf year} (24 hours for benzene and ethylene dichloride).
According to Region 6 of the US EPA, no health effects are thought to occur below this level.

brief_description: The {\bf Acute} ($<2$ week) ATSDR Minimal Risk Level
long_description: According to the American Toxic Substances and Disease Registry,   there is no appreciable risk of \emph{non-cancer} health effects from being exposed to concentrations up to this level over periods of {\bf up to 2 weeks}.

brief_description: The {\bf Intermediate} (2 wks - 1 yr) ATSDR Minimal Risk
long_description: According to the American Toxic Substances and Disease Registry,   there is no appreciable risk of \emph{non-cancer} health effects from being exposed to concentrations up to this level over periods of {\bf  between 2 weeks and one year}.

brief_description: The {\bf Chronic} ($>$ 1 yr) ATSDR Minimal Risk
long_description: According to the American Toxic Substances and Disease Registry,   there is no appreciable risk of non-cancer health effects from being exposed to concentrations up to this level over periods {\bf longer than one year}.
Concentrations above this level are illegal in Louisiana. This level refers to the average level over an {\bf 8-hour}  period.

brief_description: The Louisiana Annual Ambient Air Standard
long_description: Concentrations above this level are illegal in Louisiana. This level refers to the average level over a period of {\bf one year}.
